chapter.title: Module
chapter.para: The enhances the level of communication between the different actors of international trade operations.

section.title: Overview
section.para: As a client user you can:

listitem.para: Create a list of tasks for any event.
Assign tasks to users in your company, and follow up on each of these tasks through reports and a system of automatic alerts.
Assign tasks to the company's bank and communicate freely with the bank during the preparation phase of a transaction.

section.para: There are 3 different types of tasks:

listitem.para: Private task - Created, maintained and visible only by the user who created it.
Public task - Created by an initial user, it is visible to all users of the same company and entity, as the one attached to the transaction to which the task is associated.
Assigned task - Created by an initial user and assigned to either of the following users/party:
Another user in the same company: The task is only visible to initial user and assignee user, and only these users can update its status,
An external party, that is, the bank: The task is visible to all users in the same entity as the initial user, and also to all users in the external company.

section.para: Typically, a task is a query from the current user to the bank in order to complete the transaction. Any user with access to a task can add a comment to it. These comments are visible to the users according to the same rules as the visibility of a task.

listitem.para: While creating a task, you can place a check mark at the Notify issuer by email checkbox, for e-mail alerts to be sent to you, upon occurrence of any event on this task.
While assigning a task, you can place a check mark at the Notify assignee by email checkbox, for e-mail alert to be sent to assignee.

section.para: When the Collaboration Suite is enabled, a task list, initially empty, is created for each transaction managed in such as, for instance, the initiation, amendments and more. This task list is maintained by the users in your company until the transaction is submitted to the bank. From this moment, the list of tasks is frozen but the company's users can still access the history of the transaction's tasks and comments.

section.title: Task
section.para: The client user interface has three different options to create tasks. This section describes different ways the task feature can be used. Later sections in this chapter describe the Task layout in detail.

section.title: Collaboration Window (Tasks)
section.para: When you use any function that initiates a transaction like Request Letter of Credit, the form that opens has Tasks tab beside Section in the left side navigation menu. This window is generally referred as the Collaboration Window. You can click on it to see existing tasks on the transaction or create new task.

To create a new task on the transaction click Create task, fill in a small sub-form, and click Create. Assuming you create a task for LC Initiation transaction and save the task. You can reopen the form from Drafts tab to see the task in list in Collaboration Window. The same view is available to any other authorized user.

To reply to a task, you can add a comment to it by clicking Comments by its entry to display all its existing comments, and then click Add Comment. Users other than the creator cannot edit the task, but can add comments. These comments typically form a conversation between the creator of a task and the person who carries it out.

Each task has Pending Action on the the task card. This is marking task as completed. The user can mark the task as completed. Once this is done, the creator can no longer edit the task, but people can still add comments to it.

section.title: Collaboration Window
section.para: This section describes the Collaboration Window in detail.

In the input form for every event of every product and in the transaction's details screen in the history, there is a window for managing the tasks associated with the current transaction, where you can perform the following:

listitem.para: Add a new comment to a task.

section.title: Field Details
section.para: The Collaboration Window is termed as Tasks, and lists all assigned and public tasks on this transaction. The fields for each task are described below:

entry.para: Select the type of task you wish to create:

listitem.para: Self: To be completed by task creator.
Public: Can be done by anyone in your company.
Assign: Assign task to any other user selected entity or bank.

entry.para: Enter the details of the task.

row.entry: Specify the entity, in case the user is associated with multiple entities. This entity will be used for transaction creation also.

entry.para:
Place the check mark in the checkbox to receive notification by email in case of any event occurring on this task.
By default, the notification is disable, place the check mark to enable it. This is applicable only for Public and Assign Tasks.
Email address to use for the above notification.
Default value is your usual email address, if defined in your profile. If not, then this field is a mandatory field if the above Notify issuer by email check box is checked.

row.entry: To assign the task to bank
Name of the user in case the assignment is to another user in the entity. Name of the bank in case of task is being assigned to bank

entry.para:
Place the check mark in the checkbox to send e-mail notification to the assignee.
By default, the notification is disable, place the check mark to enable it. This is applicable only for Assign Tasks.
Email address of the assignee, where e-mail notification will be sent. The field is auto-filled with the assignee e-mail address.
Add the task to the list of tasks and close the sub-form.
Close the sub-form without adding the task to the list.

section.title: Comments Sub-form
section.para: When you click Comment on a listed task card in the Collaboration Window, the following sub-form appears:

row.entry: Text box where you can enter the new comment.

section.title: Task Listing
section.para: All the which are associated to event appears as card on after the another based on the type of task and assignment
Task creator: Will be able to see all the task associated to event
Task Assignee: Will be able to see all the tasks assigned to him along with public tasks
Task creator or assignee can mark task as completed by clicking on Pending Action. The same button can be used to open completed task also.
